bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Branch Bank of Old Dominion conducted business in the town of Pearisburg in Giles County, Virginia, during the mid-nineteenth century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Two letter books, one dated 1859-1860 and the second dated 1860-1862, of Branch Bank of Old Dominion, Pearisburg. They record the bank's correspondence with account holders, cashiers, and other banks. Information found in letter books relate to the financial activities of the bank including withdrawals, deposits, payments, receipts, and collections. There are also references in some of the correspondence to repeal of a redemption law in Virginia.
